intro: Eulophiopsis medemiae, commonly known as the Medem's clubmoss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, spirally arranged leaves and a creeping growth habit. This plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Eulophiopsis medemiae plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem. Its reproductive structures, known as strobila, are borne on the upper part of the plant.
